paper_metadata.title: The Impact of an Economic Empowerment Intervention on Economic Security Among HIV/AIDS-Orphaned Adolescents in Southern Uganda: Depression as a Moderator

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Mixed-effects regression models assessed EEI impact on economic security, measured through physical assets (20-item index) and financial assets (savings yes/no). Depression (Child Depression Inventory) was included as a moderator.
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: Data from 1383 HIV-orphaned adolescents (10-16 years) were collected from 48 primary schools in Masaka, Uganda (2011-2016), under the Bridges to the Future study.

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: Data from 1383 HIV-orphaned adolescents (10-16 years) were collected from 48 primary schools in Masaka, Uganda (2011-2016), under the Bridges to the Future study.
evidence_citations.country_citation: Data from 1383 HIV-orphaned adolescents (10-16 years) were collected from 48 primary schools in Masaka, Uganda (2011-2016)
